vulnerabilities.title: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apt` package. It was found that apt-key in apt, all versions, do not correctly validate gpg keys with the master keyring, leading to a potential man-in-the-middle attack. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `apt`. ## References - [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=642480) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-3374) - [MISC](https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2011/CVE-2011-3374.html) - [MISC](https://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2011/Sep/221) - [MISC](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-LINUX-APT-116518) - [MISC](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2011-3374) - [RedHat CVE Database](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2011-3374)
vulnerabilities.name: apt/libapt-pkg5.0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Check for Dropped Privileges
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `bash` package. An issue was discovered in disable_priv_mode in shell.c in GNU Bash through 5.0 patch 11. By default, if Bash is run with its effective UID not equal to its real UID, it will drop privileges by setting its effective UID to its real UID. However, it does so incorrectly. On Linux and other systems that support "saved UID" functionality, the saved UID is not dropped. An attacker with command execution in the shell can use "enable -f" for runtime loading of a new builtin, which can be a shared object that calls setuid() and therefore regains privileges. However, binaries running with an effective UID of 0 are unaffected. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `bash`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0003/) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-18276) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202105-34) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/bminor/bash/commit/951bdaad7a18cc0dc1036bba86b18b90874d39ff) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/155498/Bash-5.0-Patch-11-Privilege-Escalation.html) - [MISC](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-wGtxJ8opa8) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-18276)
vulnerabilities.name: bash

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `coreutils` package. chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `coreutils`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2781) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/2) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/3) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-2781)
vulnerabilities.name: coreutils

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `coreutils` package. In GNU Coreutils through 8.29, chown-core.c in chown and chgrp does not prevent replacement of a plain file with a symlink during use of the POSIX "-R -L" options, which allows local users to modify the ownership of arbitrary files by leveraging a race condition. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `coreutils`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-18018) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-18018) - [http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/coreutils/2017-12/msg00045.html](http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/coreutils/2017-12/msg00045.html)
vulnerabilities.name: coreutils

vulnerabilities.title: XML External Entity (XXE) Injection
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `expat` package. expat 2.1.0 and earlier does not properly handle entities expansion unless an application developer uses the XML_SetEntityDeclHandler function, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption), send HTTP requests to intranet servers, or read arbitrary files via a crafted XML document, aka an XML External Entity (XXE) issue. NOTE: it could be argued that because expat already provides the ability to disable external entity expansion, the responsibility for resolving this issue lies with application developers; according to this argument, this entry should be REJECTed, and each affected application would need its own CVE. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `expat`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-0340) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201701-21) - [http://securitytracker.com/id?1028213](http://securitytracker.com/id?1028213) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/02/22/3) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/04/12/6) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/58233)
vulnerabilities.name: expat/libexpat1

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gcc-8` package. stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `gcc-8`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://gcc.gnu.org/viewcvs/gcc/trunk/gcc/config/arm/arm-protos.h?revision=266379&view=markup) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-12886) - [MISC](https://www.gnu.org/software/gcc/gcc-8/changes.html)
vulnerabilities.name: gcc-8/libstdc++6

vulnerabilities.title: Insufficient Entropy
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gcc-8` package. The POWER9 backend in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) before version 10 could optimize multiple calls of the __builtin_darn intrinsic into a single call, thus reducing the entropy of the random number generator. This occurred because a volatile operation was not specified. For example, within a single execution of a program, the output of every __builtin_darn() call may be the same. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `gcc-8`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-15847) - [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=91481) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00056.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00057.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-05/msg00058.html)
vulnerabilities.name: gcc-8/libstdc++6

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-27618) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

The iconv feature in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.32, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in the EUC-KR encoding, may have a buffer over-read. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3 encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3326) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210304-0007/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27256) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=7d88c6142c6efc160c0ee5e4f85cde382c072888) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/28/2)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Double Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-27645) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7LZNT6KTMCCWPWXEOGSHD3YLYZKUGMH5/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/I7TS26LIZSOBLGJEZMJX4PXT5BQDE2WS/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27462)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33574) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(|)(\\1\\1)*' in grep, a different issue than CVE-2018-20796. NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability because the behavior occurs only with a crafted pattern. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K26346590?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9192) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24269) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9192)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\\1\\1|t1|\\\2537)+' in grep. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K26346590?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20796) - [MISC](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=34141) - [MISC](https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-gnulib/2019-01/msg00108.html) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190315-0002/) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/107160) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20796)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10228) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/03/01/10) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96525) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10228)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. Stack consumption vulnerability in the regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via a regular expression containing adjacent repetition operators, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/515589/100/0/threaded) - [Cert Vulnerability Note](http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/912279) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4052) - [Exploit DB](http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/15935) - [MISC](http://cxib.net/stuff/proftpd.gnu.c) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=645859) - [Seclists Full Disclosure](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2011/Jan/78) - [SECTRACK](http://securitytracker.com/id?1024832) - [Secunia Advisory](http://secunia.com/advisories/42547) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/45233) - [SREASON](http://securityreason.com/securityalert/8003) - [SREASONRES](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/93)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The glob implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via crafted glob expressions that do not match any pathnames, as demonstrated by glob expressions in STAT commands to an FTP daemon, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2632. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4756) - [http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c](http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c) - [http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89) - [http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223](http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2010-4051
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a regular expression containing adjacent bounded repetitions that bypass the intended RE_DUP_MAX limitation, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD, related to a "RE_DUP_MAX overflow." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/515589/100/0/threaded) - [Cert Vulnerability Note](http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/912279) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4051) - [Exploit DB](http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/15935) - [MISC](http://cxib.net/stuff/proftpd.gnu.c) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rc713534b10f9daeee2e0990239fa407e2118e4aa9e88a7041177497c@%3Cissues.guacamole.apache.org%3E) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=645859) - [Seclists Full Disclosure](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2011/Jan/78) - [SECTRACK](http://securitytracker.com/id?1024832) - [Secunia Advisory](http://secunia.com/advisories/42547) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/45233) - [SREASON](http://securityreason.com/securityalert/8003) - [SREASONRES](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/93)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass stack guard protection. The component is: nptl. The attack vector is: Exploit stack buffer overflow vulnerability and use this bypass vulnerability to bypass stack guard. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010022) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22850) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22850#c3) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010022)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded library with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K11932200?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010023) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22851) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/109167) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010023)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. On the x86-64 architecture, the GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.31 fails to ignore the LD_PREFER_MAP_32BIT_EXEC environment variable during program execution after a security transition, allowing local attackers to restrict the possible mapping addresses for loaded libraries and thus bypass ASLR for a setuid program. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19126) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4FQ5LC6JOYSOYFPRUZ4S45KL6IP3RPPZ/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZFJ5E7NWOL6ROE5QVICHKIOUGCPFJVUH/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25204) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19126)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-10029) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10029) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/JZTFUD5VH2GU3YOXA2KBQSBIDZRDWNZ3/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/VU5JJGENOK7K4X5RYAA5PL647C6HD22E/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/23N76M3EDP2GIW4GOIQRYTKRE7PPBRB2/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25487) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=9333498794cde1d5cca518badf79533a24114b6f) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200327-0003/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00033.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1751) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1751) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25423) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1751) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25414) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;h=ddc650e9b3dc916eab417ce9f79e67337b05035c) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1752) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200511-0005/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1752) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1752)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620) - [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. vulnerabilities.title: Double Free

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33574) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0005/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(|)(\\1\\1)*' in grep, a different issue than CVE-2018-20796. NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability because the behavior occurs only with a crafted pattern. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K26346590?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9192) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24269) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9192)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10228) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/03/01/10) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/96525) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10228)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. Stack consumption vulnerability in the regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via a regular expression containing adjacent repetition operators, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/515589/100/0/threaded) - [Cert Vulnerability Note](http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/912279) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4052) - [Exploit DB](http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/15935) - [MISC](http://cxib.net/stuff/proftpd.gnu.c) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=645859) - [Seclists Full Disclosure](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2011/Jan/78) - [SECTRACK](http://securitytracker.com/id?1024832) - [Secunia Advisory](http://secunia.com/advisories/42547) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/45233) - [SREASON](http://securityreason.com/securityalert/8003) - [SREASONRES](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/93)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The glob implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via crafted glob expressions that do not match any pathnames, as demonstrated by glob expressions in STAT commands to an FTP daemon, a different vulnerability than CVE-2010-2632. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4756) - [http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c](http://cxib.net/stuff/glob-0day.c) - [http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/89) - [http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223](http://securityreason.com/exploitalert/9223)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2010-4051
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The regcomp implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.11.3, and 2.12.x through 2.12.2, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a regular expression containing adjacent bounded repetitions that bypass the intended RE_DUP_MAX limitation, as demonstrated by a {10,}{10,}{10,}{10,}{10,} sequence in the proftpd.gnu.c exploit for ProFTPD, related to a "RE_DUP_MAX overflow." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/515589/100/0/threaded) - [Cert Vulnerability Note](http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/912279) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-4051) - [Exploit DB](http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/15935) - [MISC](http://cxib.net/stuff/proftpd.gnu.c) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rc713534b10f9daeee2e0990239fa407e2118e4aa9e88a7041177497c@%3Cissues.guacamole.apache.org%3E) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=645859) - [Seclists Full Disclosure](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2011/Jan/78) - [SECTRACK](http://securitytracker.com/id?1024832) - [Secunia Advisory](http://secunia.com/advisories/42547) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/45233) - [SREASON](http://securityreason.com/securityalert/8003) - [SREASONRES](http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/93)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass stack guard protection. The component is: nptl. The attack vector is: Exploit stack buffer overflow vulnerability and use this bypass vulnerability to bypass stack guard. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010022) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22850) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22850#c3) - [UBUNTU](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2019-1010022)

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded library with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code. vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. On the x86-64 architecture, the GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.31 fails to ignore the LD_PREFER_MAP_32BIT_EXEC environment variable during program execution after a security transition, allowing local attackers to restrict the possible mapping addresses for loaded libraries and thus bypass ASLR for a setuid program. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19126) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4FQ5LC6JOYSOYFPRUZ4S45KL6IP3RPPZ/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZFJ5E7NWOL6ROE5QVICHKIOUGCPFJVUH/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25204) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19126)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-10029) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10029) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/JZTFUD5VH2GU3YOXA2KBQSBIDZRDWNZ3/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/VU5JJGENOK7K4X5RYAA5PL647C6HD22E/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/23N76M3EDP2GIW4GOIQRYTKRE7PPBRB2/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25487) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=9333498794cde1d5cca518badf79533a24114b6f) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200327-0003/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00033.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1751) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1751) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25423) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1751) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25414) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;h=ddc650e9b3dc916eab417ce9f79e67337b05035c) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1752) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200511-0005/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1752) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1752)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620) - [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gnutls28` package. The SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a "BEAST" attack. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `gnutls28`. ## References - vulnerabilities.title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. cipher/elgamal.c in Libgcrypt through 1.8.2, when used to encrypt messages directly, improperly encodes plaintexts, which allows attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading ciphertext data (i.e., it does not have semantic security in face of a ciphertext-only attack). The Decisional Diffie-Hellman (DDH) assumption does not hold for Libgcrypt's ElGamal implementation. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6829) - [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal) - [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal/wiki) - [MISC](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gcrypt-devel/2018-February/004394.html) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2020.html)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. It was discovered that there was a ECDSA timing attack in the libgcrypt20 cryptographic library. Version affected: 1.8.4-5, 1.7.6-2+deb9u3, and 1.6.3-2+deb8u4. Versions fixed: 1.8.5-2 and 1.6.3-2+deb8u7. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-13627) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/09/msg00024.html) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/01/msg00001.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13627) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-32) - [GitHub Release](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/releases/tag/libgcrypt-1.8.5) - [MISC](https://minerva.crocs.fi.muni.cz/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00060.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-01/msg00018.html) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/10/02/2) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13627) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-2/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-3/)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libidn2` package. GNU libidn2 before 2.2.0 fails to perform the roundtrip checks specified in RFC3490 Section 4.2 when converting A-labels to U-labels. This makes it possible in some circumstances for one domain to impersonate another. By creating a malicious domain that matches a target domain except for the inclusion of certain punycoded Unicode characters (that would be discarded when converted first to a Unicode label and then back to an ASCII label), arbitrary domains can be impersonated. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `libidn2`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/commit/614117ef6e4c60e1950d742e3edf0a0ef8d389de) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-12290) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/3UFT76Y7OSGPZV3EBEHD6ISVUM3DLARM/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KXDKYWFV6N2HHVSE67FFDM7G3FEL2ZNE/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ONG3GJRRJO35COPGVJXXSZLU4J5Y42AT/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RSI4TI2JTQWQ3YEUX5X36GTVGKO4QKZ5/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/U6ZXL2RDNQRAHCMKWPOMJFKYJ344X4HL/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-63) - [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/commit/241e8f486134793cb0f4a5b0e5817a97883401f5) - [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/merge_requests/71) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-12/msg00008.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-12/msg00009.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-12290) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4168-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libseccomp` package. libseccomp before 2.4.0 did not correctly generate 64-bit syscall argument comparisons using the arithmetic operators (LT, GT, LE, GE), which might able to lead to bypassing seccomp filters and potential privilege escalations. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `libseccomp`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-9893) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9893) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201904-18) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/seccomp/libseccomp/issues/139) - [Oss-Sec Mailing List](https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2019/q1/179) - [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3624) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00022.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00027.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9893) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4001-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4001-2/)

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libsepol` package. vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libtasn1-6` package. GNU Libtasn1-4.13 libtasn1-4.13 version libtasn1-4.13, libtasn1-4.12 contains a DoS, specifically CPU usage will reach 100% when running asn1Paser against the POC due to an issue in _asn1_expand_object_id(p_tree), after a long time, the program will be killed. This attack appears to be exploitable via parsing a crafted file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `libtasn1-6`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/libtasn1/issues/4) - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000654) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000654) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-06/msg00009.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-06/msg00018.html) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/105151) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000654)

vulnerabilities.title: Buffer Overflow
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `lz4` package. LZ4 before 1.9.2 has a heap-based buffer overflow in LZ4_write32 (related to LZ4_compress_destSize), affecting applications that call LZ4_compress_fast with a large input. (This issue can also lead to data corruption.) NOTE: the vendor states "only a few specific / uncommon usages of the API are at risk." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `lz4`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-17543) - LZ4 before 1.9.2 has a heap-based buffer overflow in LZ4_write32 (related to LZ4_compress_destSize), affecting applications that call LZ4_compress_fast with a large input. (This issue can also lead to data corruption.) NOTE: the vendor states "only a few specific / uncommon usages of the API are at risk." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `lz4`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-17543) - [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/25015588b770d67470b7ba7ea49a305d6735dd7f00eabe7d50ec1e17@%3Cissues.arrow.apache.org%3E) - [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/793012683dc0fa6819b7c2560e6cf990811014c40c7d75412099c357@%3Cissues.arrow.apache.org%3E) - [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/9ff0606d16be2ab6a81619e1c9e23c3e251756638e36272c8c8b7fa3@%3Cissues.arrow.apache.org%3E) - [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/f0038c4fab2ee25aee849ebeff6b33b3aa89e07ccfb06b5c87b36316@%3Cissues.arrow.apache.org%3E) - [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/f506bc371d4a068d5d84d7361293568f61167d3a1c3e91f0def2d7d3@%3Cdev.arrow.apache.org%3E) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-17543) - [GitHub Diff](https://github.com/lz4/lz4/compare/v1.9.1...v1.9.2) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/lz4/lz4/issues/801) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/lz4/lz4/pull/756) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/lz4/lz4/pull/760) - [MISC](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=15941) - [MISC](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r0fb226357e7988a241b06b93bab065bcea2eb38658b382e485960e26@%3Cissues.kudu.apache.org%3E) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2020.html) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/543302d55e2d2da4311994e9b0debdc676bf3fd05e1a2be3407aa2d6@%3Cissues.arrow.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r4068ba81066792f2b4d208b39c4c4713c5d4c79bd8cb6c1904af5720@%3Cissues.kudu.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r7bc72200f94298bc9a0e35637f388deb53467ca4b2e2ad1ff66d8960@%3Cissues.kudu.apache.org%3E) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00069.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00070.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-17543)

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `openssl` package. The NIST SP 800-90A default statement of the Dual Elliptic Curve Deterministic Random Bit Generation (Dual_EC_DRBG) algorithm contains point Q constants with a possible relationship to certain "skeleton key" values, which might allow context-dependent attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms by leveraging knowledge of those values. NOTE: this is a preliminary CVE for Dual_EC_DRBG; future research may provide additional details about point Q and associated attacks, and could potentially lead to a RECAST or REJECT of this CVE. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `openssl`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2007-6755) - [http://arstechnica.com/security/2013/09/stop-using-nsa-influence-code-in-our-product-rsa-tells-customers/](http://arstechnica.com/security/2013/09/stop-using-nsa-influence-code-in-our-product-rsa-tells-customers/) - [http://blog.cryptographyengineering.com/2013/09/rsa-warns-developers-against-its-own.html](http://blog.cryptographyengineering.com/2013/09/rsa-warns-developers-against-its-own.html) - [http://blog.cryptographyengineering.com/2013/09/the-many-flaws-of-dualecdrbg.html](http://blog.cryptographyengineering.com/2013/09/the-many-flaws-of-dualecdrbg.html) - [http://rump2007.cr.yp.to/15-shumow.pdf](http://rump2007.cr.yp.to/15-shumow.pdf) - [http://stream.wsj.com/story/latest-headlines/SS-2-63399/SS-2-332655/](http://stream.wsj.com/story/latest-headlines/SS-2-63399/SS-2-332655/) - [https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2007/11/the_strange_sto.html](https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2007/11/the_strange_sto.html) - [http://threatpost.com/in-wake-of-latest-crypto-revelations-everything-is-suspect](http://threatpost.com/in-wake-of-latest-crypto-revelations-everything-is-suspect) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/63657)
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl1.1

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `openssl` package. OpenSSL 0.9.8i on the Gaisler Research LEON3 SoC on the Xilinx Virtex-II Pro FPGA uses a Fixed Width Exponentiation (FWE) algorithm for certain signature calculations, and does not verify the signature before providing it to a caller, which makes it easier for physically proximate attackers to determine the private key via a modified supply voltage for the microprocessor, related to a "fault-based attack." ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `openssl`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2010-0928) - [http://rdist.root.org/2010/03/08/attacking-rsa-exponentiation-with-fault-injection/](http://rdist.root.org/2010/03/08/attacking-rsa-exponentiation-with-fault-injection/) - [http://www.eecs.umich.edu/%7Evaleria/research/publications/DATE10RSA.pdf](http://www.eecs.umich.edu/%7Evaleria/research/publications/DATE10RSA.pdf) - [http://www.networkworld.com/news/2010/030410-rsa-security-attack.html](http://www.networkworld.com/news/2010/030410-rsa-security-attack.html) - [http://www.theregister.co.uk/2010/03/04/severe_openssl_vulnerability/](http://www.theregister.co.uk/2010/03/04/severe_openssl_vulnerability/) - [http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/56750](http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/56750) - [X-force Vulnerability Report](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/56750)
vulnerabilities.name: openssl/libssl1.1

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. Stack-based buffer overflow in the pcre32_copy_substring function in pcre_get.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (WRITE of size 4) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `pcre3`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-7245) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-7245) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201710-25) - [MISC](https://blogs.gentoo.org/ago/2017/03/20/libpcre-two-stack-based-buffer-overflow-write-in-pcre32_copy_substring-pcre_get-c/) - [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:2486) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97067) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-7245)
vulnerabilities.name: pcre3/libpcre3

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. In PCRE 8.41, the OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c allows stack exhaustion (uncontrolled recursion) when processing a crafted regular expression. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `pcre3`. ## References - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11164) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11164) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/11/3) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99575) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-11164)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. ** DISPUTED ** In PCRE 8.41, after compiling, a pcretest load test PoC produces a crash overflow in the function match() in pcre_exec.c because of a self-recursive call. NOTE: third parties dispute the relevance of this report, noting that there are options that can be used to limit the amount of stack that is used. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `pcre3`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://bugs.exim.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2047) - [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-16231) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-16231) - [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/150897/PCRE-8.41-Buffer-Overflow.html) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/11/01/11) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/11/01/3) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/11/01/7) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/11/01/8) - [Seclists Full Disclosure](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2018/Dec/33) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101688)

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `pcre3` package. libpcre in PCRE before 8.43 allows a subject buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled, and \X or \R has more than one fixed quantifier, a related issue to CVE-2019-20454. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `pcre3`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-20838) - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-20838) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211931) - [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212147) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Dec/32) - [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Feb/14) - [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/717920) - [MISC](https://www.pcre.org/original/changelog.txt) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `perl` package. _is_safe in the File::Temp module for Perl does not properly handle symlinks. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `perl`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-4116) - [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/Perl-Toolchain-Gang/File-Temp/issues/14) - [MISC](https://rt.cpan.org/Public/Bug/Display.html?id=69106) - [Oss-Sec Mailing List](https://seclists.org/oss-sec/2011/q4/238) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/04/2) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/04/4)

vulnerabilities.title: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU)
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `shadow` package. shadow: TOCTOU (time-of-check time-of-use) race condition when copying and removing directory trees ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `shadow`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-4235) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2013-4235) - [RedHat CVE Database](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2013-4235) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2013-4235)
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `shadow` package. An issue was discovered in shadow 4.5. newgidmap (in shadow-utils) is setuid and allows an unprivileged user to be placed in a user namespace where setgroups(2) is permitted. This allows an attacker to remove themselves from a supplementary group, which may allow access to certain filesystem paths if the administrator has used "group blacklisting" (e.g., chmod g-rwx) to restrict access to paths. This flaw effectively reverts a security feature in the kernel (in particular, the /proc/self/setgroups knob) to prevent this sort of privilege escalation. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `shadow`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-7169) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201805-09) - [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/shadow/+bug/1729357) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-7169)
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd

vulnerabilities.title: Access Restriction Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `shadow` package. initscripts in rPath Linux 1 sets insecure permissions for the /var/log/btmp file, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information regarding authentication attempts. NOTE: because sshd detects the insecure permissions and does not log certain events, this also prevents sshd from logging failed authentication attempts by remote attackers. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `shadow`. ## References - [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/482129/100/100/threaded) - [BUGTRAQ](http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/482857/100/0/threaded) - [CONFIRM](https://issues.rpath.com/browse/RPL-1825) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2007-5686) - [Secunia Advisory](http://secunia.com/advisories/27215) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/26048) - [VUPEN](http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2007/3474)
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `shadow` package. shadow 4.8, in certain circumstances affecting at least Gentoo, Arch Linux, and Void Linux, allows local users to obtain root access because setuid programs are misconfigured. Specifically, this affects shadow 4.8 when compiled using --with-libpam but without explicitly passing --disable-account-tools-setuid, and without a PAM configuration suitable for use with setuid account management tools. This combination leads to account management tools (groupadd, groupdel, groupmod, useradd, userdel, usermod) that can easily be used by unprivileged local users to escalate privileges to root in multiple ways. This issue became much more relevant in approximately December 2019 when an unrelated bug was fixed (i.e., the chmod calls to suidusbins were fixed in the upstream Makefile which is now included in the release version 4.8). ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `shadow`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19882) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202008-09) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/shadow-maint/shadow/commit/edf7547ad5aa650be868cf2dac58944773c12d75) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/shadow-maint/shadow/pull/199) - [GitHub PR](https://github.com/void-linux/void-packages/pull/17580) - [MISC](https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/64836) - [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/702252)
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd

vulnerabilities.title: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU)
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `shadow` package. shadow: TOCTOU (time-of-check time-of-use) race condition when copying and removing directory trees ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `shadow`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-4235) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2013-4235) - [RedHat CVE Database](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2013-4235) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2013-4235)
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `shadow` package. An issue was discovered in shadow 4.5. newgidmap (in shadow-utils) is setuid and allows an unprivileged user to be placed in a user namespace where setgroups(2) is permitted. This allows an attacker to remove themselves from a supplementary group, which may allow access to certain filesystem paths if the administrator has used "group blacklisting" (e.g., chmod g-rwx) to restrict access to paths. This flaw effectively reverts a security feature in the kernel (in particular, the /proc/self/setgroups knob) to prevent this sort of privilege escalation. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `shadow`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-7169) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201805-09) - [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/shadow/+bug/1729357) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-7169)
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `sqlite3` package. sqlite3Select in select.c in SQLite 3.30.1 allows a crash if a sub-select uses both DISTINCT and window functions, and also has certain ORDER BY usage. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `sqlite3`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19244) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/sqlite/sqlite/commit/e59c562b3f6894f84c715772c4b116d7b5c01348) - [N/A](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2020.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19244) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4205-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3/libsqlite3-0

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `sqlite3` package. alter.c in SQLite through 3.30.1 allows attackers to trigger infinite recursion via certain types of self-referential views in conjunction with ALTER TABLE statements. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `sqlite3`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19645) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/sqlite/sqlite/commit/38096961c7cd109110ac21d3ed7dad7e0cb0ae06) - [N/A](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2020.html) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20191223-0001/) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4394-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19645)
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3/libsqlite3-0

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-19603
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `sqlite3` package. SQLite 3.30.1 mishandles certain SELECT statements with a nonexistent VIEW, leading to an application crash. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `sqlite3`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19603) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/sqlite/sqlite/commit/527cbd4a104cb93bf3994b3dd3619a6299a78b13) - [MISC](https://www.sqlite.org/) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rc713534b10f9daeee2e0990239fa407e2118e4aa9e88a7041177497c@%3Cissues.guacamole.apache.org%3E) - [N/A](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2020.html) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20191223-0001/) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4394-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19603)
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3/libsqlite3-0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `sqlite3` package. SQLite 3.30.1 mishandles certain parser-tree rewriting, related to expr.c, vdbeaux.c, and window.c. This is caused by incorrect sqlite3WindowRewrite() error handling. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `sqlite3`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19924) - [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/sqlite/sqlite/commit/8654186b0236d556aa85528c2573ee0b6ab71be3) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E) - [N/A](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2020.html) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200114-0003/) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4298-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3/libsqlite3-0

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `sqlite3` package. In SQLite through 3.31.1, the ALTER TABLE implementation has a use-after-free, as demonstrated by an ORDER BY clause that belongs to a compound SELECT statement. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `sqlite3`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11656) - [FREEBSD](https://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-20:22.sqlite.asc) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202007-26) - [MISC](https://www3.sqlite.org/cgi/src/info/b64674919f673602) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuApr2021.html) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2021.html) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujul2020.html) - [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2020.html) - [MISC](https://www.sqlite.org/src/info/d09f8c3621d5f7f8) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200416-0001/)
vulnerabilities.name: sqlite3/libsqlite3-0
